ratings.comment: You'll get at least an AB in this class. There were 5 books but I barely finish reading all of them. As long as you know the main themes in each book, you'll be fine. 2 papers & 1 take home final.
Coolest guy ever, so much enthusiasm.  TAKE HIS CLASSES!!!!
The worst grade you'll get is an AB. Seems like a lot of readings (we had 5 textbooks) but I almost never really finish reading all of them.
Love this man

very knowledgeable, go in so that he or one of the TA's can check papers tests are easy very minimal study. lectures are not mandatory if reading were read and vice versa. Overall an excellent professor

Best professor I've ever had at UW. He's very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject matter, relates abstract concepts of religion to very relatable experiences, and takes his job very seriously. He is so eloquent that I could listen to him lecture all day. Definitely take a class with him if you have the chance.

This class is extremely easy, I don't think anyone can fail the class; this is an easy A/AB. He is a very passionate man and very knowledgable about Hinduism. Often makes interesting comments or jokes. Great professor, but you really need to be interested in Hinduism itself.
He's very passionate !

definitely one of the best lecturer i had so far. very passionate about stuff that he teaches. definitely recommend him for those who want to have a great time learning something revolving about religions. awesome!
I had him for Intro to Hinduism. He's an awesome professor! Very entertaining and helpful. Does a good job of making things fun and the class is pretty easy overall
Incredibly passionate and knowledgeable on what he teaches. Great professor. Got an AB with minimal work.
Loves what he's teaching, super easy class, don't need to go after the second exam except for attendance.

Donald Davis is very passionate about Hinduism. He is refreshing to listen to and extremely endearing. Material is boring and useless in my mind though. There are few assignments and they are very easy (2 exams & 3 one page essays) but basically everyone gets an AB or a B. Hard to get A's on the essays. Pretty good class though.

Awesome teacher.  I am a 5th year senior and he was hands down the best teacher I have had through 5 years.  When you compare his passionate, intellectual lectures to a scatter-brained, nonsensical lecture by Anne Hansen you wonder how some people get teaching jobs.  Highly recommend.

By far the best prof. I've ever had in my life. He is extraordinarily passionate about the subjects he teaches and is always willing to answer additional questions outside of class. DEFINITELY take a course with him if you can. : )

Davis is an awesome guy. Really funny and laid back. I would strongly recommend finishing the readings BEFORE lecture, otherwise you will be super bored and not have any idea what he's talking about. He encourages participation throughout the entire lecture. Only 2 short papers due and tests are fair. Overall, great class, great guy.

This was the first time he taught "Law and Religion". There are three segments: Early Christianity, Hindu and Islamic Law, and the US. This class was hard because he is very vague in his descriptions for papers. It really helps to visit his office hours to clarify your thesis. Overall I really liked this call and it was interesting.
Best Professor at UW by far. Extremely knowledgeable, makes you want to come to class, and has a poetic way of relating otherwise difficult or abstract topics. Really worth taking his classes.

Davis absolutely loves his subject which makes him a decent lecturer.  However, I found the class to be difficult and the topics to be confusing, despite my attendance to every lecture.  He also cancelled office hours the week of an exam.  Overall though, I liked him.  My bad experience may be due to little interest in the subject.

He gives you two exams and 3 assignments (one paper). You have to read to get through his class, otherwise this class is an easy A. Towards the end of the semester though, he really doesn't have much to talk about, so rambles a bit. He is also not always available on email. Take this class if you like Hinduism.
Excellent prof!
Wonderful teacher.  I have taken two of his classes so far and I plan on taking more in the future.  Very clear and entertaining.
Great Prof! Very interested in the subject and wants you to do well in his class. I did very little and got an AB. He rarely gives lower than a B.  Very interesting subject too!

GREAT TEACHER!!! Would really recommend this class even if you are not into religion at all! He is such a great teacher. Also, if you go to his office hours to get help with your short papers, he pretty much will give you an idea! Also, it is probably the easiest 4 credit class you will ever take.

Probably the best teacher I've had in college so far.  Easy tests and homework and his lectures are engaging.  His papers are short but the grading is kind of arbitrary so it's hard to get an A on them, but you won't get lower than a B.  No tests after mid semester and no final

He's an excellent teacher. He's one of few professors that really just wants his students to learn. He speaks with the style of a motivational speaker. I attended every class, and it was well worth it!
One of few professor's who seem to want students to do well across the board.  Gives review sheets, answers all qustions.  Very good professor, and very enthusiastic.
extremely helpful. test are extremely easy. easy grade.

he is great. takes his job seriosly, and really strives to be as good. very very fair grader, rarely gives under a B. and hilarious, but doesnt compromise the material. definately a class worht taking.
Davis does a great job of relating diverse religions to college students.  He makes you want to go to class and keeps you captivated the entire time.  I'm taking any class he teaches!!
He is awesome. He is funny, and the class isnt too bad. Also he lets class out early when he has nothing else left to say. Probably one of the best professors at this school.

My favorite prof at UW.  VERY engaging and interesting.  Turns lecture on eastern religions into the daily show.  hilarious guy who really loves what he teaches.  Truly an expert in his field on many different topics in eastern religions.  I skipped a lot of classes in college but never his.  I will be sneaking in next semester to hear him lecture
